p: The EOs of T. capitata, L. luisieri, F. vulgare and D. ambrosioides significantly reduced TNF-α release by LPS-stimulated THP-1 cells, in comparison to the control cells. From these four EOs, those of T. capitata and L. luisieri were the most effective. T. capitata EO showed an inhibition percentage of TNF-α release of 51 ± 7% at 20 μg/mL, whereas that of L. luisieri EO was 23 ± 1% at 30 μg/mL and 83 ± 8% at 90 μg/mL ( Table 4). These inhibition percentages were higher than those of D. ambrosioides EO (49 ± 2% at 90 μg/mL), or F. vulgare EO (22 ± 2% at 90 μg/mL) ( Table 4).
